form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Gillibrand (for herself, Mr. Portman, Ms. Stabenow, Mr. Kirk, and Mr. Peters) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To prohibit the sale or distribution of cosmetics containing synthetic plastic microbeads.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Microbead-Free Waters Act of 2015.

section.header: Prohibition against sale or distribution of cosmetics containing synthetic plastic microbeads

subsection.text: Section 601 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 361) is amended by adding at the end the following:
If it contains synthetic plastic microbeads.
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take effect on January 1, 2018.
